subject: Ethics
title: International AI Treaties
description: A quick, practical guide to International AI Treaties.

hook.text: Nuclear weapons got treaties within years. AI has reshaped the world for a decade with almost zero global rules.

buildup.text: The UN, OECD, and G7 have all proposed AI principles. None are legally binding.

discovery.text: International AI governance faces a trust gap: nations racing for AI dominance won't limit their own advantage.

twist.text: Unlike nuclear material, AI code crosses borders instantly. You can't inspect neural networks with satellites.

climax.text: Without enforceable treaties, AI governance remains a patchwork of national laws and voluntary pledges.

punchline.text: Global technology. Local rules. The math doesn't add up.

quiz.question: Why is creating binding international AI treaties so challenging?
options: AI technology is too simple to need regulation
All nations already agree on AI governance principles
Nations in an AI race resist limiting their own competitive advantage
